original: bhri sha la sogs pa rnams las shin tu ba ma yin pa shin tu bar gyur pa lta bu gsar byung gi don tsvi byin pa'i mtha' ma yin pa la don de dag la kyang 'gyur zhing /

translated: bhr̥śaḥ, very; unnataḥ, high; śīghraḥ, quick; paṇḍitaḥ, learned; utsūkaḥ, striving; abhimānaḥ, conceit; durmanāḥ, unhappy; nṛpaḥ, king; śuciḥ, pure; nīlaḥ, blue; vajraḥ, diamond; phenaḥ, foam; viṣṭhā, feces; hariṭaḥ, green; madhuraḥ, sweet, etc.

analyzed: ro mantha dang ta pas dag la g-yo ba'i las la 'jug pa la'o //

analyzed: ro manth'a ya te goo/...(ba lang skyugs bldad byed/) ta pa sya te/...(dka' thub la 'gro/) sogs te /

analyzed: 'grel par ta pas kyang gi mtha' can la aa tad rnams 'jug par bshad do //

analyzed: (lut)...ae sha yi t'a / (smon ling)...ae shy'ata / sogs so // shve t'a shv'a shva ta ra ga lo di t'a hva ra k'a ka n'am manta ka lo pashtsa / shve ta / aa shva / aa shva ta ra / ga lo di / aa hva ra / k'a ka rnams kyi mtha' dbyi'o // shve ta la sogs pa 'di rnams las rang (dbang ldan/) don la nitsa 'gyur zhing nitsa pha rol la rtags 'di rnams kyi mtha' yang dbyi bar bya ste / (lat)...shve ta ya ti / (lung)...aa shi shvi tata /
translated: ༼ལུཏ༽ “is”🔽༼སྨོན་ལིང༽ “is”🔽etc.🔽śvetāśva-tāra-gar-lo-ditā-hava-rakā-kanām-anta-ka-lopaśca🔽śveta🔽aśva🔽aśva-tāra🔽galo-di🔽a-hava-ra🔽kā-ka-nām-anta🔽In the case of these śveta, etc., the -ka is changed to -i for the benefit of oneself, and the -ka is elided for the benefit of others.🔽༼ལཏ༽ “śveta-ya-ti”🔽༼ལུང༽ “aśi-śvi-tta”🔽

original: (lit)...shva ta y'am tsa k'a (dkar po /🔽rta / rta mchog /🔽mnga' thang can /🔽kun du nod pa /🔽bya rog /) ra /🔽(lut)...shve ta yi t'a /🔽(smon ling)...shve ty'ata /🔽sogs so // de bzhin du /🔽(lat)...aa shva ya ti /🔽(lung)...a'a sha shvata /🔽(lit)...aa shva y'am tsa k'a ra /🔽(lut)...aa shva yi t'a /
analyzed: (lit)...shva ta y'am tsa k'a (dkar po /🔽rta / rta mchog /🔽mnga' thang can /🔽kun du nod pa /🔽bya rog /) ra /🔽(lut)...shve ta yi t'a /🔽(smon ling)...shve ty'ata /🔽sogs so // de bzhin du /🔽(lat)...aa shva ya ti /🔽(lung)...a'a sha shvata /🔽(lit)...aa shva y'am tsa k'a ra /🔽(lut)...aa shva yi t'a /
translated: ༼ལིཏ༽  śavataṃ cakāra.🔽༼དཀར་པོ་།🔽རྟ་། རྟ་མཆོག་།🔽མངའ་ཐང་ཅན་།🔽ཀུན་དུ་ནོད་པ་།🔽བྱ་རོག་།༽🔽༼ལུཏ༽  śvetaṃ yitā.🔽༼སྨོན་ལིང༽  śvetyātā.🔽སོགས་སོ་།།🔽དེ་བཞིན་དུ་།🔽༼ལཏ༽  aśvayati.🔽༼ལུང༽  aśaśvat.🔽༼ལིཏ༽  aśvayāṃ cakāra.🔽༼ལུཏ༽  aśvayitā.🔽

analyzed: bhu nakti pri thi r'a dz'a /

translated: From gṛddhi and vañci, the ṇa affix is for the one who causes to take and the one who causes to deceive.

translated: Translation: When the words gṛdhra and paṇḍita are used in the sense of “one who obtains the best,” the -aṃ becomes -aṅ.🔽 Translation: When the words gṛdhra and paṇḍita are used in the sense of “one who obtains the best,” the -aṃ becomes -aṅ.🔽 Translation: When the words gṛdhra and paṇḍita are used in the sense of “one who obtains the best,” the -aṃ becomes -aṅ.🔽 Translation: When the words gṛdhra and paṇḍita are used in the sense of “one who obtains the best,” the -aṃ becomes -aṅ.🔽 Translation: When the words gṛdhra and paṇḍita are used in the sense of “one who obtains the best,” the -aṃ becomes -aṅ.🔽 Translation: When the words gṛdhra and paṇḍita are used in the sense of “one who obtains the best,” the -aṃ becomes -aṅ.

original: aa pa ba da te /
analyzed: aa pa ba da te /
translated: Translation: When the words gṛdhra and paṇḍita are used in the sense of “one who obtains the best,” the -aṃ becomes -aṅ.

original: sogs so // sa mu d'ang bhyo ya mo& granthe /
analyzed: sogs so // sa mu d'ang bhyo ya mo& granthe /
translated: Translation: When the words gṛdhra and paṇḍita are used in the sense of “one who obtains the best,” the -aṃ becomes -

original: sam auta a'ang (gnas log pa byed du 'jug/) rnams las yam las gzhung ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: sam auta a'ang (gnas log pa byed du 'jug/) rnams las yam las gzhung ma yin pa la'o //
translated: The Samuttas, from Yam, are in the case of the improper.

original: sam auta aang rnams las pha rol gyi yam las gzhung ma yin pa'i yul la 'bras bu ldan pa'i byed pa po la tang rnams 'gyur te /
analyzed: sam auta aang rnams las pha rol gyi yam las gzhung ma yin pa'i yul la 'bras bu ldan pa'i byed pa po la tang rnams 'gyur te /
translated: The Samuttas, from Paramattam, are in the case of the possessor of the fruit, the agent, in the improper country.

original: (skur pa 'debs par byed/) br'i h'in sam yatstsa te /
analyzed: (skur pa 'debs par byed/) br'i h'in sam yatstsa te /
translated: The Taddhitās are in the case of the denigrator.

original: bh'a ra mud++yatstse ti/...(khur 'degs par byed/) radzdzu m'a yatstsa te/...(thag pa kun du 'degs par byed/) sogs so //
analyzed: bh'a ra mud++yatstse ti/...(khur 'degs par byed/) radzdzu m'a yatstsa te/...(thag pa kun du 'degs par byed/) sogs so //
translated: The Bharaṇḍus are in the case of the bearer, the Raddhas in the case of the bearer of the rope, and so on.

original: aa nu pa sarg'at dznya:/
analyzed: aa nu pa sarg'at dznya:/

original: nyer bsgyur med pa las dzny'a las so //
analyzed: nyer bsgyur med pa las dzny'a las so //
translated: The jñās are from the indeclinables.

original: nyer bsgyur sngon na med pa'i dzny'a las 'bras bu ldan pa'i byed pa po la ta da rnams 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyer bsgyur sngon na med pa'i dzny'a las 'bras bu ldan pa'i byed pa po la ta da rnams 'gyur te /
translated: The Taddhitās are in the case of the possessor of the fruit, the agent, in the case of the jñās that are not preceded by a prefix.

original: g'am dz'a ('bru rnams sbyin par byed) @412b n'i te /
analyzed: g'am dz'a ('bru rnams sbyin par byed) @412b n'i te /
translated: The Gams or Jās are in the case of the giver of grain.🔽And so on.

original: sogs so // bi bh'a sho pa p'a de na pra ti ya m'a ne /
analyzed: sogs so // bi bh'a sho pa p'a de na pra ti ya m'a ne /

original: nye ba'i tshig rtogs pa la gdam nga'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i tshig rtogs pa la gdam nga'o //
translated: The upasargas are the guides to understanding.

original: nye ba'i tshig rtogs ba'i 'bras bu ldan pa'i byed pa po la tang dang aa tang rnams 'dam ka can du bya ste /🔽sva ya dznyam ya dza te /
analyzed: nye ba'i tshig rtogs ba'i 'bras bu ldan pa'i byed pa po la tang dang aa tang rnams 'dam ka can du bya ste / sva ya dznyam ya dza te /
translated: The suffixes taṃ and a taṃ are used optionally for the agent that has the result of understanding.🔽svayaṃ yajñam yajate

original: sva yadznyam ya dza ti /🔽sogs so // ai ti p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na sya s'u tr'addh'a (ba lang rnams shes par byed/) t'u pa sarga yo g'a:sa m'apt'a:/
analyzed: sva yadznyam ya dza ti / sogs so // ai ti p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na sya s'u tr'addh'a (ba lang rnams shes par byed/) t'u pa sarga yo g'a:sa m'apt'a:/

original: zhes pa p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na'i mdo las byings dang nyer bsgyur sbyor ba rnams rdzogs so /
analyzed: zhes pa p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na'i mdo las byings dang nyer bsgyur sbyor ba rnams rdzogs so /
translated: Thus, the applications of the roots and the prefixes in the sūtra of the Pāṇini grammar are complete.

original: // / de rnams kyis barda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen po p'a ni ni (rang nyid mchod sbyin sbyin par byed/) by'a ka ra na gzhung 'grel gyi ga don cho ga dper brjod sogs zin bris su bkod pa legs bshad nor bu 'dren pa'i shing rta zhes bya ba
analyzed: // / de rnams kyis barda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen po p'a ni ni (rang nyid mchod sbyin sbyin par byed/) by'a ka ra na gzhung 'grel gyi ga don cho ga dper brjod sogs zin bris su bkod pa legs bshad nor bu 'dren pa'i shing rta zhes bya ba
translated: This is called “A Chariot to Guide the Jewel of Eloquence,” a record of the meaning of the text and commentary of the great treatise on grammar, the Pāṇini grammar, with examples of rituals, and so on.

original: las byings dang nyer bsgyur sbyor tshul /
analyzed: las byings dang nyer bsgyur sbyor tshul /
translated: The way to apply the roots and prefixes

original: nyer bsgyur la brten nas a'atma ne pa da dang pa rasmee pa da sbyor tshul gyi dbye ba sogs rags pa rnams re zhig rdzogs so /
analyzed: nyer bsgyur la brten nas a'atma ne pa da dang pa rasmee pa da sbyor tshul gyi dbye ba sogs rags pa rnams re zhig rdzogs so /
translated: The rough divisions of the ways of combining ātmīya and parasmai pada by means of prefixes and so forth are for the moment complete.

original: // / da ni dngos po dang las kyi skabs su dgos pa'i rkyen sogs kyi cho ga rnams bshad par bya ste /🔽bh'a ba karma ne /
analyzed: // / da ni dngos po dang las kyi skabs su dgos pa'i rkyen sogs kyi cho ga rnams bshad par bya ste / bh'a ba karma ne /
translated: Now I will explain the rules of the required conditions and so forth in the context of nouns and verbs.🔽bhāva karmaṇe

original: dngos po dang las las so //
analyzed: dngos po dang las las so //

original: byings las dngos po dang las kyi don la lat sogs a'atma ne ba da rnams rtag tu 'gyur zhing a'atma ne pa da rnams kyi'ang skyes bu dang po'i gcig tshig kho na rtag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: byings las dngos po dang las kyi don la lat sogs a'atma ne ba da rnams rtag tu 'gyur zhing a'atma ne pa da rnams kyi'ang skyes bu dang po'i gcig tshig kho na rtag tu 'gyur te /
translated: From the verbal roots, the meanings of noun and verb are always formed by lta and so forth, and the parasmai padam endings are always formed by the first person singular of the ātmīya.

original: de yang byings kyi sngon du nyer bsgyur med pa'i dbang du byas pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang byings kyi sngon du nyer bsgyur med pa'i dbang du byas pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, this is from the perspective of there being no prefix before the verbal root.

original: nyer bsgyur sngon du byung na der ma nges te /
analyzed: nyer bsgyur sngon du byung na der ma nges te /
translated: If a prefix occurs before it, it is not certain.

original: lat sogs a'atma ne pa da dgu po rnams thams cad 'jug cing der ma zad byings las med pa rnams las can du 'gyur ba dang las can las med du 'gyur ba sogs nyer bsgyur stobs che ba'i dbang gis mtha' yas so //
analyzed: lat sogs a'atma ne pa da dgu po rnams thams cad 'jug cing der ma zad byings las med pa rnams las can du 'gyur ba dang las can las med du 'gyur ba sogs nyer bsgyur stobs che ba'i dbang gis mtha' yas so //
translated: The nine, lat, etc., are added to all. Not only that, by the power of the prefix, the infinite number of changes such as the one with case ending becoming one without case ending and the one without case ending becoming one with case ending, etc., occur.🔽Sarva-dhātuka-yak

original: sarba dh'a tu ke yaka / byings thams cad pa rnams las yaka'o //
analyzed: sarba dh'a tu ke yaka / byings thams cad pa rnams las yaka'o //

original: byings las dang bcas pa rnams la las kyi don dang / byings las med pa rnams la dngos po'i don du rnam dbye byings thams cad pa rnams pha rol la rkyen yaka 'gyur te ka yon tan 'gog pa'i don no /
analyzed: byings las dang bcas pa rnams la las kyi don dang / byings las med pa rnams la dngos po'i don du rnam dbye byings thams cad pa rnams pha rol la rkyen yaka 'gyur te ka yon tan 'gog pa'i don no /
translated: For the roots with case endings, the case ending is the meaning, and for the roots without case endings, the thing is the meaning. The distinction is made. All the roots with case endings become the condition yak for the other. Ka is the meaning of stopping the quality.

original: ` / bh'u la yaka sbyar bas /
analyzed: ` / bh'u la yaka sbyar bas /
translated: When bhu is combined with yak,

original: bh'u ya zhes pa la lat /
analyzed: bh'u ya zhes pa la lat /
translated: bhu-yak becomes bhu-ya.🔽When the first person singular of the atamne is combined with lat,

analyzed: ling: lot: lang rnams kyi a'atma ne ba da'i skyes bu dang po'i gcig tshig rnams sbyar bas / bh'u ya te /

analyzed: bh'u ye ta / bh'u ya t'am /

analyzed: aa bh'u yata sogs te /

analyzed: aa nu bh'u ya te a'a nanda shtsee tre na tva y'a/...(nag pa zla ba'i khyod kyis dga' ba rjes su thob/) aa nu bh'u @413a * //

analyzed: ya te a'a nanda shtse tre na m'a y'a /

analyzed: nyer bsgyur sngon du byung na a'atma ne pa da thams cad sbyor te / aa nu bh'u ya te /
translated: When the prefix is in front, all of the pada of ātmanepada are applied.🔽anubhūyate

analyzed: aa nu bh'u ye te / aa nu bh'u yante /

analyzed: sogs so // byings phyed pa rnams la yaka mi 'gyur bas /

analyzed: lung la / tsin bh'a bakarma no:/
translated: in the aphorism: cin bhāva karmaṇoḥ

original: dngos po dang las dag la tsina'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang las dag la tsina'o //
translated: cin is for things and actions.

original: (nag pa zla ba'i bdag gis dga' ba rjes su thob/) dngos po dang las kyi don la lung bsgyur bas ta pha rol la tsli ni tsi nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: (nag pa zla ba'i bdag gis dga' ba rjes su thob/) dngos po dang las kyi don la lung bsgyur bas ta pha rol la tsli ni tsi nar 'gyur te /
translated: Since the aphorism is translated for the meaning of things and actions, in the other, cin becomes ci.

original: bh'u la: lung: lung la tsli 'os tsli tsi nar bsgyur la ta /
analyzed: bh'u la: lung: lung la tsli 'os tsli tsi nar bsgyur la ta /
translated: In bhūlaḥ, lun, and lun, ci is translated as ci, and ta is added.

analyzed: aatsa'i nya na 'gro ba la 'os 'phel ba byas /

analyzed: tsina las 'jig gos ta phyis pas /
translated: Cin is destroyed by karma, and ta is later.

analyzed: aa bh'a bi /

analyzed: sya sitsa s'i yut t'a si shu bh'a ba karma no ru ba de she ha na gra ha dri sh'am tsa nva di d'a /

analyzed: dngos po dang las dag las nye ba'i yul dang han gra ha dri sha rnams kyis sya /
translated: For things and actions, the near locative and hanagrahādṛśa take sy.

analyzed: si tsa: s'i yut: t'a si rnams la tsina bzhin ait yang na'o //
translated: For syasiciyutāsi, it is like can.

original: dngos po dang las kyi don la nye ba'i yul te byings aatsa mtha' can ait 'jug pa rnams dang graha la tsin bzhin ait la 'phel ba dang yang na bar byed la /
analyzed: dngos po dang las kyi don la nye ba'i yul te byings aatsa mtha' can ait 'jug pa rnams dang graha la tsin bzhin ait la 'phel ba dang yang na bar byed la /
translated: The near locative is for the meaning of things and actions. Roots ending in ac take it. For graha, it is like can. It increases.🔽For roots ending in ac that do not take it, and for han and dṛś, it is either it or it increases like can.

original: byings aa tsa mtha' can ait mi 'jug pa rnams dang han dang drisha dag la ait yang na bar 'gyur zhing ait sbyin pa'i phyogs la tsin bzhin 'phel brtag tu byed de /

translated: For the side of giving it, it is like can.

original: de'ang rkyen sya dang sitsa dang s'i yut dang / t'a si rnams gang rung pha rol na yod pa la ste /
analyzed: de'ang rkyen sya dang sitsa dang s'i yut dang / t'a si rnams gang rung pha rol na yod pa la ste /
